page.title: 07THE LIBRARY: TILBURY
page.content: {The Library}was built in 1928. It was first used as a museum then became a library. These are the staff; Ann, Betty, Margaret and Judith. Ann has been with the library for 22 years and working in Tilbury library for 14 years. The oldest book in the library is about{Essex}and was printed in 1909. There are{8300 books}altogether and 268 records. Every year around Â£2600 to Â£3000 is spent on books. There are 1569 adult ticket holders and 2513 junior ticket holders. Every day 300 to 400 books are taken out. The three main jobs are; stamping books out,counting stock and putting books back on the shelves. The non-fiction books use the{DEWEY} system, the fiction is arranged alphabetically. There are, suprisingly, more children than adults using the library!
